records.text: I've long been a fan of Art Pepper (the musician if not the person), and this is a recent purchase I'm currently working though (7 CDs!).It's near the end, but he seems pretty strong in his playing. Maybe a bit slurrier and off the pace than, say, the Vanguard dates of a few years before, but definitely worth hearing if you like his work.I struggle a bit with Laurie Pepper's rather defensive liner notes (see also the Complete Artists House box set) but it's a nice glossy package.#Jazz #NowPlaying

records.text: Twin Sons From Different Mothers: Harmonic Convergence In Jazz And Classical Music, Part 4: "The Neapolitan 6th Chord In Jazz And Classical Music"The "Neapolitan 6th" chord (N6) is another sonority whose definition is based on the triad that it makes, which is a vertical perspective that glosses over its actual horizontal function. It is described in theory texts as the chord on the lowered supertonic (scale degree 2) in first inversion. #jazz https://www.allaboutjazz.com/twin-sons-from-different-mothers-harmonic-convergence-in-jazz-and-classical-music-part-4-the-neapolitan-6th-chord-in-jazz-and-classical-music

records.text: From a research perspective last week was a disaster, from a productivity perspective, the weekend was a game changer.I've been scanning and collecting magazines for the last 5-years. I did a deal with another collector, I'll scan and return if he provided them for free. I had folders with some 4,500 magazines, just over 65GB of data... unusable for searching... over an hour to find all instances of Deodato.I moved all the magazines to structured folders on an external SSD, created and Index using FileLocator Pro, same query 1-second to search the index and get the same results.

records.text: Twin Sons From Different Mothers: Harmonic Convergence In Jazz And Classical Music, Part 4: "The Neapolitan 6th Chord In Jazz And Classical Music"The "Neapolitan 6th" chord (N6) is another sonority whose definition is based on the triad that it makes, which is a vertical perspective that glosses over its actual horizontal function. It is described in theory texts as the chord on the lowered supertonic (scale degree 2) in first inversion. #jazz https://www.allaboutjazz.com/twin-sons-from-different-mothers-harmonic-convergence-in-jazz-and-classical-music-part-4-the-neapolitan-6th-chord-in-jazz-and-classical-music

records.text: From a research perspective last week was a disaster, from a productivity perspective, the weekend was a game changer.I've been scanning and collecting magazines for the last 5-years. I did a deal with another collector, I'll scan and return if he provided them for free. I had folders with some 4,500 magazines, just over 65GB of data... unusable for searching... over an hour to find all instances of Deodato.I moved all the magazines to structured folders on an external SSD, created and Index using FileLocator Pro, same query 1-second to search the index and get the same results.

records.text: I've long been a fan of Art Pepper (the musician if not the person), and this is a recent purchase I'm currently working though (7 CDs!).It's near the end, but he seems pretty strong in his playing. Maybe a bit slurrier and off the pace than, say, the Vanguard dates of a few years before, but definitely worth hearing if you like his work.I struggle a bit with Laurie Pepper's rather defensive liner notes (see also the Complete Artists House box set) but it's a nice glossy package.#Jazz #NowPlaying
